item.title: Russia oil minister: We came up with oil cuts proposal well before 'certain tweets' appeared
item.description: Russia’s push to increase oil production came independently of tweets by certain political leaders, the country’s oil minister said Saturday during the OPEC summit in Vienna.

item.title: This floating robotic factory will build satellites and spaceships in orbit
item.description: The Archinaut, a system made of 3-D printers and robotic arms, could be the flying factory humans need to colonize space.

item.title: Meet the man whose job it is to reassure people that Google search isn’t evil

item.title: What Tim Cook says coming out cost him—and why he still has 'no regrets'
item.description: Apple CEO Tim Cook was the first CEO of a Fortune 500 company to come out as gay in 2014.

item.title: Nearly two-thirds of CFOs say US trade policy will hurt their companies over the next 6 months
item.description: With a trade war looming, CFOs are growing seriously concerned, according to the latest CNBC Global CFO Council survey.

item.title: China's sorghum imports in May jump, despite anti-dumping probe
item.description: China's imports of sorghum in May rose 59 percent year on year to 470,000 tonnes, customs data showed on Saturday, despite an anti-dumping move by Beijing a month earlier that had roiled the grains trade.

item.title: US Navy drafts plans to house 25,000 immigrants at cost of $233m
item.description: The U.S. Navy is drafting plans to house up to 25,000 immigrants on its bases and other facilities, at an estimated cost of about $233 million over six months, as the Trump administration seeks to ease a mounting crisis on the Mexican border.

item.title: Pentagon indefinitely suspends some training exercises with South Korea
item.description: The United States and South Korea have agreed to indefinitely suspend two exchange program training exercises, the Pentagon said on Friday, after the summit earlier this month between U.S. President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.

item.title: Hats are all the rage at the UK's Royal Ascot racing event: Here are some of the most eye-catching
item.description: The UK's Royal Ascot racing event is considered one of the U.K.'s biggest and poshest social event of the year.

item.description: Firefighters out West are preparing for what could be another difficult summer wildfire season.

item.description: Federal regulators launched a probe into whether or not companies have improperly rounded up their earnings per share to the next highest cent.

item.description: New York organizations receive more federal funding for housing unaccompanied migrants than those in any state except Texas.
